thread.section_title: Louisville News, Sports, Business | The Courier-Journal
thread.title: 6 shows that will rock Louisville this week
thread.title_full: 6 shows that will rock Louisville this week

author: courier-journal.com
title: 6 shows that will rock Louisville this week
text:
1. The Louisville Outskirts Festival kicks off with three days of eclectic music showcasing female artists. The Vallures, YaNi, Kate Wakefield, Rheonna Thornton, Black Birds of Paradise and Frederick the Younger perform.
WHEN: 7 p.m. Friday
WHERE: The New Vintage, 2126 S. Preston St.
COST: $15 advance, $20 day of show
Downtown Boys (Photo: Provided)
2. Outskirts Fest continues with punk, dance and 1920s music from Â¡MOXIE TUNG! (Sally Timms and Janet Bean), Downtown Boys, Half-Seas-Over, Psalm One, Babe Rage, Brazilian Wax, Big Momma Thorazine and killii killii.
WHEN: 6:30 p.m. Saturday
WHERE: The New Vintage, 2126 S. Preston St.
COST: $15 advance, $20 day of show
Freakwater (Photo: Provided)
3. The Outskirts Fest wraps up with Freakwater, the band that accidentally invented alternative country, with The Birdies, Softcheque, Blind Tigers, Sorry Mom and the Outskirts Rockshops for Girls Showcase.
WHEN: 5 p.m. Sunday
WHERE: Art Sanctuary,1433 S. Shelby St.
COST: $15 advance, $20 day of show
Diarrhea Planet (Photo: Provided)
4. Diarrhea Planet comes from Nashville, the new home of full-postal rock 'n' roll, with songs expressly designed to fracture skulls. BRENDA and The Tommys open.
WHEN: 9 p.m. Friday
WHERE: Zanzabar, 2100 S. Preston St.
COST: $8 advance, $10 day of show
Josh Groban (Photo: Provided)
5. Josh Groban, a very popular singer, is touring behind a new album, "Stages," on which he tackles songs from a variety of Broadway musicals. Broadway singer-actress Lena Hall opens.
WHEN: 7:30 p.m. Tuesday
WHERE: Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St.
COST: $57.50, $84.50, $150
Father John Misty (Photo: Provided)
6. Father John Misty, birth name Josh Tillman, makes frequently intense and very beautiful folk music that often plays like an inside joke. Tess & Dave open with some lost 1960s pop.
WHEN: 8 p.m. Thursday
WHERE: Louisville Palace, 625 S. Fourth St.
COST: $25, $35, $25, $76
